News.title: BJP sets up manifesto panel for year-end Chhattisgarh polls
News.description: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) in Chhattisgarh has set up a 31-member panel to draft its manifesto for the year-end Assembly polls. The panel will be headed by Lok Sabha MP Vijay Baghel and include MLA Shivratan Sharma, former MP Ramvichar Netam and ex-state minister Amar Agrawal. The BJP was deposed from power in the state by the Congress in 2018 after 15 years.

News.title: Decision on alliance with BJP for 2024 polls to be announced soon; Chirag Paswan set to return to NDA
DMK will oppose BJP, says M K Stalin
News.description: Stalin said that the collective goal of the opposition parties during the recent meeting at Patna was to defeat the BJP in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections.He said that the BJP led Union government has not fulfilled its poll promises since coming to power in 2014.

News.title: Digvijaya Singh booked over controversial social media post on ex-RSS chief Golwalkar
"Decision will be taken after 2-3 more meetings," says Chirag Paswan on forging alliance with NDA
News.description: Amid speculation of Lok Janshakti Party (Ram Vilas) president Chirag Paswan joining the NDA, the latter on Sunday said that he will take a call regarding forming an alliance for the upcoming 2024 Lok Sabha elections after 2-3 more meetings with party leaders.

News.title: Agnipath has shattered dreams of youth to serve country, alleges Congress
News.description: The Congress on Sunday slammed the BJP-led Centre over the military recruitment scheme Agnipath, alleging that it has shattered the dreams of the youth to serve the country and created various apprehensions in their minds.

News.title: "A powerhouse of talent": PM Modi meets awe autistic singer Kamisetty Venkat in Warangal
News.description: "In Warangal, I met families of those who lost their near and dear ones to Left Wing Extremism. Their stories moved me profoundly and so did their strength in the face of adversity. Their resilience inspires us to keep working to build a peaceful and prosperous society," PM Modi tweeted. Addressing a public rally earlier in Warangal, PM Modi came down heavily on Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrasekhar Rao and the BRS government, as well as the Congress, over corruption.

News.title: Tripura chief minister Manik Saha sends pineapples to Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina as a gift
News.description: The meticulously chosen pineapples, renowned for their exquisite taste, were sent as a reciprocal gesture in response to the Haribhanga mangoes presented by Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to Chief Minister Saha on behalf of the Government of Bangladesh.

News.title: BJP appoints 10 new national executive members
News.description: A party statement said the new national executive members are Bandi Sanjay Kumar, Deepak Prakash, Satish Punia and Sanjay Jaiswal, former BJP presidents in Telangana, Jharkhand, Rajasthan and Bihar, respectively.

News.title: West Bengal Panchayat elections have become a festival of death: MoS Nisith Pramanik
BJP seems to have plans to destroy state-level parties: Sharad Pawar
News.description: ​​Speaking to reporters in Nashik city, he said he has seen politics of former prime ministers Jawaharlal Nehru, Indira Gandhi, Rajiv Gandhi, Atal Bihari Vajpayee and P V Narasimha Rao, all of whom spoke (critically) about opposition parties but never sought to silence the Opposition.

News.title: WB Panchayat Polls: Fresh case of violence and stone pelting reported in Malda
Chhattisgarh liquor revenue went up in more than four years, no scam: CM Bhupesh Baghel
News.description: A day earlier, Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched a scathing attack on Congress during a rally in Raipur saying the party had promised a liquor ban in Chhattisgarh, but in reality, crores of rupees of liquor scam went into the account of the party.

News.title: Karnataka HC stays investigation into poll code violation case against BJP chief Nadda
News.description: The High Court of Karnataka has stayed the investigation against BJP national president JP Nadda for allegedly violating the model code of conduct in an election speech during the recent Karnataka Assembly polls. The criminal petition filed by Nadda seeking to cancel the case registered against him by the Harappanahalli police was heard by a single judge bench of Justice M Nagaprasanna that gave an interim order staying the investigation on Friday and adjourned the hearing of the petition to July 21.

News.title: PM Modi takes dig at BRS, AAP in Delhi excise policy scam, calls KCR govt "most corrupt"
News.description: In a veiled dig at the ruling BRS in Telangana and the AAP government in Delhi, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday said it was for the first time that allegations of corruption deal between two political parties and state governments were cropping up. "There used to be news on agreements between two countries or states on development projects. There used to be news that there was an agreement between two states for water.. But, this is the first time allegations of deals for corruption between two parties and two state governments are made. This is unfortunate," Modi said indirectly referring to the AAP and BRS.

News.title: Restoration of political process, statehood key to normalcy in J-K, says Congress leader Karan Singh
News.description: Senior Congress leader Karan Singh has called for early assembly elections in Jammu and Kashmir and reinstating its statehood. While he acknowledged the improved law and order situation and the implementation of development projects, he said the political process has to be restored for complete normalcy. Panchayat elections have already taken place, and Singh said that assembly elections should be held as soon as possible.

News.title: Viral video: Kids, students made to sit on roadside to welcome new NCP Minister
Maharashtra Speaker issues notices to both Sena factions over disqualification
West Bengal Panchayat Elections: Miscreants steal ballot boxes, vandalise booths; visuals emerge
Poll violence in Bengal: Two BJP workers shot at in Cooch Behar during Panchayat elections
Implementing UCC not easy like revoking Article 370, will affect all religions: Ghulam Nabi Azad
News.description: Former Union minister Ghulam Nabi Azad on Saturday cautioned the Centre over implementing a uniform civil code, saying it will affect all religions. "There is no question (of implementing it). It is not easy as it was to revoke Article 370. All religions are involved in it. Not only Muslims, but Christians and Sikhs also, tribals, Jains, Parsis, annoying all these people at once, will not be good for any government," the chairman of the Democratic Progressive Azad Party said.

News.title: Nine people killed as rural West Bengal votes in panchayat elections
News.description: Nine people were killed in election-related violence in West Bengal since midnight as voting was underway on Saturday for the three-tier panchayat polls in the state, officials said. Among those killed were five TMC members, and one worker each of the BJP, CPI(M) and Congress, and the supporter of an Independent candidate, they said.

News.title: Ex-NCP MLA Ramesh Kadam gets bail in funds misappropriation case
News.description: Former NCP MLA Ramesh Kadam has been granted bail by a special court in Mumbai in a case of misappropriation of funds in the Sahityaratna Lokshahir Annabhau Sathe Development Corporation of the Maharashtra government. Kadam, who has been in jail since 2015, was the chairman of the corporation when he allegedly hatched a conspiracy with other accused to misappropriate its funds.

News.title: Bengal under TMC known for crimes, anti-national activities, appeasement: BJP
News.description: Hitting out at the TMC over violence during the panchayat elections, BJP spokesperson and Rajya Sabha member Sudhanshu Trivedi told reporters that the state used to be a centre of art, culture and science. Now, it is known for "crimes, anti-national activities and dangerous appeasement".

News.title: Watch: Rahul Gandhi joins farmers in sowing process
Rahul Gandhi makes impromptu visit to Sonipat village, interacts with villagers, rides tractor
News.description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi made an impromptu visit to Sonipat district in Haryana and interacted with farmers in Madina village, taking part in paddy sowing and driving a tractor. The purpose of his journey is unknown, but a party member speculated that he may have been travelling from Delhi to Himachal Pradesh.

News.title: West Bengal Panchayat Polls: Voting gets underway; at least three killed after clashes break out
News.description: Violence in West Bengal during local elections continues with the Trinamool Congress (TMC) reporting the deaths of three members and members of other parties also being affected. The election polling began on Saturday, amidst reports of casualties. The previous Friday evening, a house was destroyed during clashes between the TMC and Congress party.

News.title: West Bengal: Voting begins for single phase Panchayat polls in state
News.description: In the latest flashpoint, just hours ahead of the panchayat polls, a house was vandalised in Murshidabad as the workers of the Trinamool Congress and Congress came to blows on Friday night. A team from the local police station reached the spot after receiving word of the incident. In another incident, the home of a Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) candidate in West Bengal was allegedly attacked by Trinamool Congress (TMC) workers.

News.title: UCC draft report expected to be submitted to Uttarakhand govt by July 15
News.description: "Along with the compilation of the report by the committee, the documents and annexures related to the related legal provisions are also included in favour of the recommendations. All these documents will form part of the report," the source added. According to sources, Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami said that a special Vidhan Sabha session may also be convened on the UCC, if necessary. "Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami has indicated that, if necessary, a special session of the Vidhan Sabha can also be called on the UCC," said the source.

News.title: West Bengal Panchayat Election 2023: Voting begins; over 5 crore people to vote
Mekedatu to use excess water for Bengaluru, not denying TN’s share: Priyank Kharge
News.description: In 2022, the Congress, which was then in opposition in Karnataka, had taken out a padayatra, demanding the ruling BJP hasten the implementation of the project. The BJP had then said that the Congress had no moral right to protest as it had done nothing for the project when it was in power.

News.title: Governor holds SEC responsible for West Bengal violence
News.description: “Mr SEC, Bengal expects to do your duty. Have you done your duty? Do you know what your duty is? I appointed you as SEC, but you disappointed people. You have failed in your duty and you have failed Bengal. You have no time to listen to the people,” West Bengal governor CV Ananda Bose alleged.

News.title: Leaders faced fallout of NCP breaking vow to BJP: Chhagan Bhujbal
News.description: While Ajit Pawar is the deputy chief minister, Bhujbal and Mushrif are among the nine ministers who have been sworn in. “They should not have gone to talk to them (BJP) if they were not serious. You should not have spoken to them if you are not serious. But, if you do, then you should honour the commitment,” said Bhujbal.

News.title: Rajasthan: BJP campaign against Ashok Gehlot to focus on women and youth
News.description: As part of the programme, the BJP unit organised a protest of women leaders and party workers on Wednesday. BJP Mahila Morcha president Alka Mundra, party MPs Diya Kumar Singh and Ranjeeta Koli led the protest from BJP office to the chief minister’s house. The leaders highlighted incidents of ‘atrocities on women’ and alleged the state has become number one in crime against women. On July 12, BJP will organise a gathering of farmers in Jhunjhunu where senior state leaders will address the gathering.

News.title: Delimitation exercise in Assam requires wider consensus: Congress
News.description: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge on Friday raised strong objection to the delimitation exercise being carried out in Assam and said it requires wider acceptance and consensus. Opposition leaders had met the Congress president on Thursday evening and handed over a representation on their collective opposition to the delimitation exercise.

News.title: Chhattisgarh has become ATM of Congress, corruption its biggest ideology: PM Modi in Raipur
BJP chief J P Nadda chairs meeting of party leaders from various states
News.description: The meeting also comes ahead of assembly elections in Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh, Madhya Pradesh, Telangana and Mizoram. On Thursday, a similar meeting was held with leaders, mostly from eastern and northeastern states, in Guwahati. BJP leaders from southern states and Maharashtra will meet in Hyderabad on Sunday.

News.title: After Bengal rural polls, BGPM will remain only relevant party in hills: GTA chief Anit Thapa
News.description: Gorkhaland Territorial Administration (GTA) chief executive Anit Thapa claimed that his Bharatiya Gorkha Prajatantrik Morcha (BGPM) will remain "the only relevant party " in the Himalayan foothills of West Bengal as it will "sweep the July 8 rural elections ".

News.title: Senthil Balaji HCP: Arguments to commence before third judge on Jul 11
News.description: The Madras High Court will hear the Habeas Corpus Petition brought by the wife of Tamil Nadu Minister V Senthil Balaji from July 11 after a split verdict by a division bench earlier on the matter. Justice C V Karthikeyan, who was named as the third judge to hear the HCP, passed an order on Friday to commence the arguments from July 11.

News.title: BJP appoints election in-charges for Telangana, MP, Chhattisgarh and Rajasthan
Speaker of Tripura assembly Biswa Bandhu Sen suspends five opposition MLAs
News.description: Opposition members of Tipra Motha Party (TMP), CPI-M and the Congress -- staged walkout protesting the Speaker’s decision while demanding disciplinary action against BJP MLA Jadab Lal Debnath, who was caught on camera watching an obscene video on his mobile phone while the Tripura Assembly session was going on in March.

News.title: Tripura: Porn movie-watching issue sparks ruckus in Assembly between BJP and Tipra Motha MLAs
Gujarat HC verdict on defamation case against Rahul Gandhi: Defamation law was misused, says Singhvi
Karnataka Budget: Siddaramaiah government hikes tax on  IMFL and beer
Delhi excise case: ED attaches over Rs 52 crore worth assets of Manish Sisodia and others
Congress slams US Ambassador Eric Garcetti for Manipur comments
News.description: Speaking in Kolkata on Thursday, Garcetti reportedly said the violence in Manipur are a matter of "human concern" and the US is "ready to assist" India in dealing with the situation "if asked"..

News.title: Two workers of Congress, BJP killed as Bengal gears up for panchayat polls
News.description: West Bengal Pradesh Congress president, Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said, "Another death has been gifted to us by West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee. We will dig the grave of Trinamool in Bengal.

News.title: Karnataka: CM Siddaramaiah taps booze, property markets to fund poll pledges
News.description: The excise duty has been proposed to be increased by 20% on Indian-made liquor. On beer, the additional excise duty will be raised to 185% from 175%. "Even after the increase in excise rates, the price of liquor in our state would be lower when compared to the neighbouring states," the chief minister said, presenting the fiscal 2023-24 budget of the new Congress government

News.title: Infra push in backward belts about social justice: PM Modi
News.description: In his speech, the prime minister said nine years ago, more than 20% of the villages in Chhattisgarh did not have any mobile connectivity but today this figure has come down to 6%. Farmers and laborers are the biggest beneficiaries of this. Modi also pointed out that most of these tribal villages where connectivity has improved were the ones ones affected by Naxalite violence.
